thread.title: First Alert: Temperatures are warming up ahead of Christmas
thread.title_full: First Alert: Temperatures are warming up ahead of Christmas

author: @wsfa12news
title: First Alert: Temperatures are warming up ahead of Christmas
text:
First Alert: Temperatures are warming up ahead of Christmas
The weekend starts sunny and dry, allowing temperatures to warm up
MONTGOMERY, Ala. (WSFA) - The start of the weekend will be full of sunshine and warmth as temperatures begin to rise into the mid-60s for your afternoon highs. Saturday will remain dry, before we track a few isolated showers for your Sunday.
This morning will start chilly with clear skies all over Central and South Alabama. Due to the clear skies, we will be able to take advantage of the sunshine, and temperatures will warm up into the mid-60s for your afternoon highs.
Clouds will become more present as we enter the evening and head into Sunday. Lows Saturday night will fall into the 40s, with a few clouds around.
Sunday could bring a brief passing shower early in the day, though rain chances remain low. Clouds will mix with sunshine, and highs will climb into the upper 60s. A few clouds linger overnight, with lows settling into the 40s.
Watch the latest live and local weather data below, streaming on WSFA Weather Now! Please note, this stream does not include live severe weather coverage, only data on the latest weather conditions.
Christmas Forecast: As we approach the holiday, long-range data shows that temperatures will be above average, nearing 70() both Christmas Eve and Christmas. Conditions will remain mostly dry, with a mix of sun and clouds both days.
